mdRecord.dcterms:title: Los Angeles Times Building, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Kaufmann, Gordon Bernie (English architect, 1888-1949, active in southern California) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In 1935, when the first part of the building was opened, Harry Chandler, then the president and general manager of Times-Mirror Co., declared the building a "monument to the progress of our city and Southern California". The building, despite its historic and architecturally significant appearance, appears not to be listed as a historic landmark. It does not appear in listings of Los Angeles Historic-Cultural Monuments, California Historical Landmarks, or U.S. Registered Historic Landmarks in Los Angeles. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles_Times_Building Limestone sculptures on the facade of the Los Angeles Times building by Robert Merrell Gage, 1935 -- http://www.publicartinla.com/art_buildings/latimes3.html [work]
